column4: WARNING; noob alert. Both to IRC and Linux. Having issues booting Ubuntu 12.04 on brand new HDD w/o OS - creating disk image and bootable USB from OSx Lion. Am I screwed from the get-go?
*Mbp for creating usb, trying to boot into stationary PC
what hardware are you running on ?
sorry, which one are you running on a macbook or a PC
running on MBP, trying to install on fresh homebuilt rack. motherboard is Asus p5q pro if that's of any help
sorry, I'm not following - what hardware platform are you trying to install ubuntu to
again, I'm still not sure what hardware platform you're actually trying to install to
could you please confirm what you are trying to install to
thanks for sticking with me on this! I'm not sure what you mean by hardware platform... could you elaborate for a lesser technical dude? =P
what type of machine are you trying to install ubuntu onto
ah... It's a home built, no specific model... Stationary cabinet w/ Asus p5q pro motherboard, Sapphire Radeon grahpics and 8gb ram
ok, but it's an "x86" or "intel" style computer, not the mac platform
intel, not a mac platform
ok, is there a reason you're not just doing a standard install from CD

yes, the machine has no optic drive =P i've already created the USB AND had it successfully boot into Ubuntu on my PC with no OS - then realizing I forgot to connect my HDD to it's SATA port. Powered down, plugged in HDD, now all I get "isolinux.bin missing or corrupt".. *scratches head*
plugging in your hard disk has probably changed the order of your disks in the bios
have tried formatting USB and starting over, as well as played wildly boot priority/device emulation and still nothing... leaning towards tip from <Wipster> that USB is screwed...
unplug your disk and try to boot the USB disk, does it still work again ?
i'll be darned.. Nope, doesn't work. USB skrewd?
it certainly sounds that way
all right, out for a new USB pen it is! Thank you guys for all your help!
